attributes.comment:
General Comment:I am writing concerning the proposed increase in fees for the
filing of the (I171H)
(1600). There are
many many fees involved in an international adoption. The costs associated with
an adoption are what many would consider exorberant. But as adoptive parents
they are paid without hesitation. It seems unreasonable first, when most
adoptions exceed the
allowable time on the I171H which is currently 18 months, and 12 months for
fingerprints. So not only are they required to pay these fees once, but a vast
majority of
the time families are taxed with paying these fees twice. And now you want to
force them to pay an increase in these fees up to 66%, twice! Let's be fair about
this. For
many adoption is the only choice they have to have a family. They prove over
and over again that they are suitable parents, by many governmental institutions.
It
seems that they are being treated unfairly. My daughter is one of those families
that have
been waiting in excess of a year. Their fingerprints expire in two months and their
immigration expires in 8 months. Which unfortuanately will force them to pay fees
that have already paid once to get a form they already have...Bottom line is that
those waiting should not have to bear the burden of increased fees for the identical
paperwork. In fact once the paperwork is completed the first time it should not
expire for the duration of that adoption effort.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Jim Renwick
